definition: to perform the sacrificial rites at a funeral
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: Who'll be chief mourner? "I, " said the dove.
sentences.chinese: 誰來當主祭？是我，鴿子說。

sentences.english: The register of his burial was signed by the clergyman, the clerk, the undertaker, and the chief mourner.
sentences.chinese: 安葬寄存器簽署了牧師，店員，承辦單位，主祭。

sentences.english: The chief La Mo presiding at the funeral was an emissary, opening up a road for the death and escorting him to the west safely.
sentences.chinese: 主祭的臘摩是爲亡魂開路和護送其安全西去的使者。

definition: to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
paraphernalia of a guard of honor
to perform one's job/attendant/job/duties/(respectful appellation for the addressee) you/your Excellency/(Church) deacon
